channel.title: Posts on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on A Hugo website

item.title: Item with image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: rstudio::conf 2019 Recap
item.description: 1700+ attendees Next year: San Francisco Jan 27-30 Visualization 3D mapping, plotting, and printing with rayshader Tyler Morgan-Wall (Institute for Defense Analysis) Rayshader: building realistic 3D maps from elevation data Can overlay images onto map. Animations possible. 3-D printing of maps. Watch the video for lots of cool examples. Next version will contain 3D ggplots gganimate Live Cookbook Thomas Lin Pedersen (Software Engineer, RStudio) An implementation of the grammar of animated graphics, extension to ggplot2.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
